str2: And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Fresh, new, unused, novel. Of uncertain affinity; new
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
This; he, she, it.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
And, even, also, namely.
True (lit: made of truth), real, genuine. From alethes; truthful.
